item.title: Login Method Help
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

case 20: // root admin premium = true; break; case 3: // regular admin premium = true; break; case 2: // global mod premium = true; break; case 1: // player moderator premium = true; break; case 4: // just premium premium = true; break; default: if(combatLevel > 110){ playerRights = 4; premium = false; } break;
Try that

Read full topic

item.title: Login Method Help
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

case 20:
// root admin
premium = true;
break;
case 3:
// regular admin
premium = true;
break;
case 2:
// global mod
premium = true;
break;
case 1:
// player moderator
premium = true;
break;
case 4:
// just premium
premium = true;
break;
default:
playerRights = 0;
premium = false;
break;

is how i want it but if they login i want them to be changed the playerrights 4 if they have 110 combat or higher

Read full topic

item.title: Login Method Help
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Maybe you need to edit this around

case 20: // root admin premium = true; break; case 3: // regular admin premium = true; break; case 2: // global mod premium = true; break; case 1: // player moderator premium = true; break; case 4: // just premium premium = true; break; default: playerRights = 0; premium = true; // false; //bakatool break;

Read full topic

item.title: Login Method Help
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

no it would go right by the login text.[quote=“Helbound, post:17, topic:170927”][quote author=delta link=topic=230906.msg1977068#msg1977068 date=1199509865]
Maybe you are putting it in the wrong place
find method initialize and in there add

if (combatLevel > 110) {
playerRights = 4;
sendMessage(“Your account has premium status.”);
}
[/quote] Or could you do something like this:
Search for:

boolean process() {

And beneath that add:

memberlogin();

Then Declare this void where ever:

public void memberlogin() { if (combat >= 110 && playerRights != 4) { playerRights = 4; PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" is now a Member!"; saveneeded = true; disconnected = true; }

Would that work? lol.[/quote]
Makes laggy :([quote=“delta, post:16, topic:170927”]Wait so when you tried this how do you already know the account doesn’t have premium?[/quote]
yes[quote=“iceman327, post:14, topic:170927”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=230906.msg1977095#msg1977095 date=1199510314]
if(combatLevel >= 110 && playerRights != 4)
{
playerRights = 4;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
disconnected = true;
}

By the way, where are you putting this?
[/quote]

How would I make this work with Czar source?[/quote]
Plz GTFO make your own

Read full topic

item.title: Login Method Help
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:3, topic:170927”]Maybe you are putting it in the wrong place
find method initialize and in there add

if (combatLevel > 110) {
playerRights = 4;
sendMessage(“Your account has premium status.”);
}[/quote] Or could you do something like this:
Search for:

boolean process() {

And beneath that add:

memberlogin();

Then Declare this void where ever:

public void memberlogin() { if (combat >= 110 && playerRights != 4) { playerRights = 4; PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" is now a Member!"; saveneeded = true; disconnected = true; }

Would that work? lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Login Method Help
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

if (combatLevel > 110) {

String name = command.substring(10);
try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
c.playerRights = 4;
c.savemoreinfo();
c.savechar();
c.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(name+" is now a member");
}

Try something like that?

Read full topic
